Package org.openlca.core.matrix.format

Interface MatrixReader

All Superinterfaces:
Copyable<MatrixReader>
All Known Subinterfaces:
Matrix
All Known Implementing Classes:
CompressedRowMatrix, CSCMatrix, DenseMatrix, HashPointMatrix, JavaMatrix
public interface MatrixReader extends Copyable<MatrixReader>

    copy

  • Method Details

    • rows

      int rows()
      Returns the number of rows of the matrix.

    • columns

      int columns()
      Returns the number of columns of the matrix.

    • get

      double get​(int row, int col)
      Get the value of the given row and column.

    • getColumn

      double[] getColumn​(int i)
      Get the row values of the given column.

    • getRow

      double[] getRow​(int i)
      Get the column values of the given row.

    • isSquare

      default boolean isSquare()
      Returns true when this matrix has the same number of rows and columns.

    • iterate

      default void iterate​(EntryFunction fn)
      Iterates over the non-zero values in this matrix. There is no defined order in which the matrix entries are processed. Specifically sparse matrix layouts should overwrite this function with faster implementations.

    • multiply

      default double[] multiply​(double[] v)
      Performs a matrix-vector multiplication with the given vector v. It uses the iterate function which can be fast for sparse matrices. For dense matrices it can be much faster to call into native code instead of using this method.

    • diag

      default double[] diag()
      Returns the diagonal of this matrix.

    • asMutable

      default Matrix asMutable()
      Converts this (immutable) reader into a mutable matrix. Returns itself if this reader is already a mutable matrix. Otherwise it creates a mutable copy.

    • asMutableCopy

      default Matrix asMutableCopy()
      Same as `asMutable` but with the guarantee that a copy is returned.

    • isSparse

      boolean isSparse()
      Returns true if the type of this implementation is a sparse matrix structure. It does **not** look into this matrix and checks if it is filled sparsely but just returns true if the storage type is optimized for sparsity.

    • isDense

      default boolean isDense()
      A matrix is dense if it is not sparse (see `isSparse`)
